main event: On 21 December 1957, in Kansas City, Missouri, a civilian observed a self-luminous object, round in shape, changing colors from red to green to blue, and then fading from sight. The duration of the observation was 10 minutes.
interesting points: The object changed color from red to green to blue, which is unusual for conventional aircraft or astronomical objects.
The object was self-luminous, meaning it emitted its own light, which is not characteristic of most conventional aircraft or astronomical objects.
The observation lasted for a significant duration of 10 minutes, allowing for a detailed study of the object.
The conclusion mentioned insufficient data for evaluation, leaving the nature of the object unexplained.
The report was made by a civilian witness, adding credibility to the observation.
sighted object: self-luminous, color-changing object in the sky
